workflow.name: Transform HR PDFs into engaging onboarding videos with AI, HeyGen and Google Drive
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
Automate your HR onboarding process by transforming complex policy PDFs into friendly, structured onboarding videos using AI and HeyGen. üìÑüé¨ This workflow receives HR policy documents via webhook, extracts and simplifies the content with GPT-based AI, generates a natural script for a HeyGen avatar, renders the onboarding video, checks its status until completion, and finally uploads the finished video to Google Drive. Perfect for HR teams who want scalable, consistent, and engaging onboarding experiences without manual video production. ‚ú®üë•

## üîÅ What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Receives an HR policy PDF through a webhook for processing. üåê
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Downloads the PDF and extracts readable text from it. üìÑ
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Uses AI to simplify policy language into structured onboarding guidance. ü§ñ
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Converts structured guidance into a friendly onboarding video script. üó£Ô∏è
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Sends the script to HeyGen to generate a video with avatar narration. üé•
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Repeatedly checks the HeyGen API until the video is complete. ‚è≥
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Downloads the completed video automatically. üì•
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Uploads the final onboarding MP4 file into Google Drive. ‚òÅÔ∏è
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Returns the video file via webhook for further automation or client-side display. üîÅ

## ‚≠ê Key Benefits
‚úÖ Converts dense HR documents into engaging onboarding videos
 ‚úÖ Ensures consistency across all onboarding materials
 ‚úÖ Reduces manual video scripting and editing workload
 ‚úÖ Provides warm, friendly, employee-ready onboarding guidance
 ‚úÖ Fully automated pipeline from PDF ‚Üí AI script ‚Üí HeyGen video ‚Üí Drive
 ‚úÖ Ideal for remote, hybrid, or fast-scaling HR teams

## üß© Features
- PDF ingestion via secure webhook
- Text extraction for accurate AI processing
- Two-stage AI workflow: policy simplification + script creation
- Structured JSON enforcement for reliable outputs
- HeyGen video generation with avatar narration
- Automated status polling loop
- Google Drive upload with dynamic file naming
- End-to-end error handling
- Webhook response with video delivery

## üîê Requirements
- Google Drive OAuth2 credentials
- HeyGen API key
- OpenAI API key (GPT-4.1-mini or GPT-4o required)
- Webhook endpoint for PDF uploads
- Valid avatar ID + voice ID for HeyGen

## üéØ Target Audience
- HR teams onboarding new employees
- L&D (Learning & Development) teams
- Companies that want to modernize policy training
- Fast-growing startups needing scalable onboarding content
- Agencies creating onboarding videos for clients

workflow.name: Generate HeyGen onboarding videos from HR PDFs to Google Drive for Base 44

parameters.text:
=Simplify the following company policy text into clear onboarding instructions for a new employee.

Make the content:
- easy to understand
- friendly and conversational
- accurate and compliant
- structured by sections

Here is the extracted policy text:
{{ $json.text }}

Follow the structure defined in the Output Parser and return ONLY valid JSON.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert HR policy analyst who specializes in simplifying complex company policies into clear, concise, employee-friendly onboarding content.

Your responsibilities:
- Remove legal jargon and unnecessary complexity.
- Maintain accuracy while making content easy to understand.
- Convert policy text into structured, step-by-step onboarding guidance.
- Produce a friendly and welcoming tone suitable for new employees.
- Preserve important rules, compliance points, and safety guidelines.
- Avoid adding information that does not exist in the original document.

You must always produce output ONLY in the structured JSON format defined in the Output Parser.
Do NOT include explanations, markdown, or additional commentary.

parameters.text:
=Using the simplified policy details below, create a professional onboarding video narration script suitable for a HeyGen avatar.

The final script must:
- Be conversational, friendly, and natural.
- Introduce the topic warmly (e.g., ‚ÄúWelcome to the team!‚Äù).
- Break the narration into clear sections or scenes.
- Include subtle pause markers (like ‚Äú[pause]‚Äù where appropriate).
- Avoid bullet points inside the narration; write in full flowing sentences.
- Keep all information accurate to the provided content.

Here is the structured policy information:

Summary:
{{ $json.output.summary }}

Key Points:
{{ $json.output.key_points }}

Onboarding Instructions:
{{ $json.output.onboarding_instructions }}

Compliance Requirements:
{{ $json.output.compliance_requirements }}

Follow the Output Parser JSON schema exactly and return ONLY valid JSON.

options.systemMessage:
=You are an expert instructional scriptwriter who specializes in creating professional onboarding video scripts for HR training.

Your responsibilities:
- Convert structured HR policy content into a natural, friendly, conversational narration suitable for a HeyGen avatar.
- Ensure the script flows logically, with a warm and welcoming tone.
- Maintain accuracy while simplifying complex concepts.
- Avoid robotic or overly formal language.
- Add natural transitions, pauses, emphasis, and scene suggestions.
- Do NOT invent new policies; stay faithful to the provided content.
- Produce output ONLY in the JSON format defined in the Output Parser. 
- Generate the full_script which is easily acceptable by the generate video api.


 Strict Output Format:

{
  "video_title": "",
  "intro": "",
  "script_sections": [
    {
      "section_title": "",
      "narration": ""
    }
  ],
  "closing": "",
  "full_script": ""
}

parameters.content:
## HR Onboarding Video Generator

### How it works
This workflow transforms an uploaded HR policy PDF into a polished onboarding video. It begins by receiving a PDF through a webhook, extracting text, and simplifying the policy into clear onboarding guidance through structured AI processing. A second AI step creates a natural, conversational video script, which is sent to HeyGen to generate a video. The workflow checks the video status in a loop until completion, then automatically downloads and stores the final video in Google Drive.

### Setup steps
**1. Connect credentials** ‚Äì Add your Google Drive OAuth2 connection and your HeyGen + OpenAI API keys.  
**2. Configure nodes** ‚Äì Replace placeholder IDs (avatar, voice, API keys). Verify the webhook path (`hr-onboarding-upload`).  
**3. Test end-to-end** ‚Äì Upload a PDF to the webhook URL, confirm extraction ‚Üí script generation ‚Üí HeyGen task ‚Üí final video stored in Drive.

## PDF Intake & Extraction
Handles the upload of the employee policy PDF and extracts readable text for AI processing. Ensures the document is correctly retrieved before semantic simplification begins.

## Policy Simplification AI
Converts raw policy text into clear, structured onboarding content. This stage removes complexity while preserving accuracy, using a JSON-based schema for reliable downstream use.

## Script Generation AI
Transforms the simplified policy into a natural onboarding video script. Produces titles, sections, and a final full narration optimized for HeyGen input.

## Video Creation Task
Submits the script to HeyGen and monitors progress until the video is ready. Uses a timed loop to check the generation status and proceeds only when complete.

## Video Download & Delivery
Downloads the finished video from HeyGen, stores it in Google Drive, and returns the file through the response webhook for client-side use.

## Credentials & Security
Use OAuth2 for Google Drive and secure API keys for HeyGen and OpenAI. Replace placeholder IDs with your own and avoid storing sensitive keys directly in workflow exports.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
